columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to value a right.

Let us first identify the given amounts in the problem: 


| | Amount$\hspace{5pt}$| 
|:--|--:| 
|Rights needed for one share| 4 rights |
|Subscription price | $35.00| 
|Share price  |$60.00|
|Ex-right price  |$53.00|
|Right per share|$3.00|

The ex-right price is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Ex-rights price}&=\dfrac{\text{(RN $\times$ S) + SP}}{\text{1 + RN }}\\
\end{aligned}$$ 

Where: 

RN = Rights needed 

S = Share price 

SP = Subscription price

Let us determine if the stock and the rights are correctly priced on the ex-rights day. First, let us know the ex-rights price of each share. This is computed by using the formula from step 3. 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Ex-rights price}&=\dfrac{\text{(4 rights $\times$ \$60.00) + \$35.00}}{\text{1 + 4}}\\
&=\dfrac{\text{\$275.00}}{\text{5}}\\
&={\textbf{\$55.00}}
\end{aligned}$$ 

**The ex-rights price amounts to $55.00.**

Then, let us also assess if the value of the rights is correctly priced. This is computed as follows: 

This is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Value of the right}&={\text{Share price - Ex-right price per share}}\\
&={\text{\$60.00 - \$53.00}}\\
&={\textbf{\$7.00}}
\end{aligned}$$ 


**The value of one right amounts to $7.00.**

The problem noted that the ex-right price amounts to $53.00. However, based on our computation on step 4, the ex-right price amounts to $55.00. 

Moreover, the problem also noted that the value of the right amounts to $3.00. However, on our computation in step 5, the right value amounts to $7.00. This implies that the new shares are priced less than their true market value on the public market after the ex-rights day. 

**Hence, the ex-rights price and the value of right is underpriced.**

From what we have noticed in this problem, the stocks and rights are underpriced. However, the prices can still generate an immediate profit. The profit is computed as follows: 


$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Profit}&={\text{Ex-rights price - [(Rights needed $\times$ Value of right) + Subscription price)]}}\\
&={\text{ \$53.00 - [(4 $\times$ \$3.00) + \$35.00)]}}\\
&={\text{ \$53.00 - \$47.00}}\\

&={\textbf{\$6.00}}
\end{aligned}$$ 
**The company will generate $6.00 profit.**
